page.title: 01Resume
page.content: A totally rural area. No industry or employment apart from agriculture. Tunstall is contracting: loss of church, shop, school. Halvergate is expanding slowly and has maintained its services. Expansion is due to commuterisation. Both villages are marsh edge settlements, with distinctive line between marsh and upland. Wooded area in N.W. of region consist of Willow and Alder carrs. Marshland is treeless and hedgeless. Grazing marshland is divided up by drainage dykes controlled by engine driven pumps. The western half is mainly arable and consists of wheat and sugar beat crops. Eastern half is totally marshland grazing for cattle and sheep with small areas being cultivated after drainage.
